item.title: Adding user to sudoers
item.description: Adding a User to Sudoers in /etc/sudoers.d/ This guide provides a one-liner to add a user to the sudoers file in a secure and organized way. Instead of modifying the main /etc/sudoers file directly, we’ll create a new file in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory. One-Liner Command echo "$USER ALL=(ALL:ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL" | sudo tee /etc/sudoers.d/$USER This command creates a new file with the same name as the current user in the /etc/sudoers.
